BiblioData.Title: NANOEMULSION THERAPEUTIC COMPOSITIONS AND METHODS OF USING THE SAME

Applicant.Name: UNIV MICHIGAN [US]
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN

BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention relates to methods and compositions for treating pulmonary infection. In particular, the present invention provides nanoemulsion compositions and methods of using the same to treat bacteria associated with biofilms (e.g., found in pulmonary infections). Compositions and methods of the present invention find use in, among other things, clinical (e.g. therapeutic and preventative medicine), industrial, and research applications.

Claims.P: CLAIMS
We Claim:
1. A method for killing and/or inhibiting growth of bacteria associated with a biofilm comprising:
A) providing: i) bacteria associated with a biofilm; and ii) a composition comprising: a nanoemulsion and ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid

(EDTA), wherein said nanoemulsion comprises: a) about 5 vol. % of Poloxamer-407; b) about 8 vol. % of ethanol; c) about 1 vol. % of cetylpyridinium chloride (CPC); d) about 64 vol. % of oil (e.g., soybean oil), and e) about 22 vol. % of water; and
B) exposing said bacteria associated with a biofilm to said composition under conditions such that said composition kills and/or inhibits growth of said bacteria.
2. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said composition further comprises a hypertonic salt solution.
3. The method of Claim 2, wherein said hypertonic salt solution is a 7% sodium chloride solution.
4. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said nanoemulsion comprises 10 mM - 20 mM EDTA.
5. The method of Claim 4, wherein said nanoemulsion comprises 20 mM EDTA.
6. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said nanoemulsion comprises droplets having an average diameter of about 400 nM.
7. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said nanoemulsion is administerd via pulmonary administration.
8. The method of Claim 7, wherein a nebulizer is utilized for said pulmonary administration.
9. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said nanoemulsion is co-administered with an antimicrobial agent.
10. The method of claim 1, wherein said composition comprises 20% nanoemulsion.
11. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said bacteria associated with a biofilm reside within the pulmonary system of a subject.
12. The method of Claim 11 , wherein said subject displays signs and/or symptoms of a respiratory infection.
13. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said bacteria associated with a biofilm reside on and/or within a subject with cystic fibrosis.
14. The method of Claim 1, wherein said bacteria associated with a biofilm are selected from the group consisting of Burkholderia cepacia and Ps eudomonas aeruginosa.
15. The method of Claim 1 , wherein said bacteria associated with a biofilm is an Acinetobacter species.
